event.name: GB_OLD_FED_STORE_AUTOCANNONS
event.text: You expect to find a well stocked Federation market at this Merchant's beacon, but instead, there's only a small station and one singular patrol ship. Hopefully there is enough to stock up on for your journey here.
You meet a friendly face as you approach the store. "Welcome, welcome. I haven't seen many folks around here on my rotation at this here posting. I assume you're looking to trade?"

choice.text: You take notice of an old Federation vessel outfitted for transport duty docked at the station. Worth investigating?

event.text: "Yep, that's my old girl. Fancy a bit of history? Me and the boys kept them in running shape since the war with the Mantis. Interested in buying something as old as she is?"

event.name: GB_FED_DESERTERS_AUTOCANNONS
event.text: A market has been opened up on the side of a heavily modified decomissioned fleetship of old Federation make, most likely one of the early batches of Aquila-class Battlecarriers that were rushed into production of the onset of the Federation-Mantis War; now a rarity outside of gutted and demilitarized sold of to the civilians, planetary militias, and anyone else needing a well protected ship for long range hauls.

choice.text: Enter the market and shop around.
Ask about the strange choice of venue for the store.

event.text: What appears to be the owner scoffs. "It's an Aquila, plenty of these things still lying around and keeps the pirates off you."

choice.text: Seems fair enough. Access his stores.

event.text: "A wise choice, sir."

choice.text: You take a good look around and notice that it's still equiped with many typical albeit old Federation equipment, and even some old worn out banners of a squadron you can't quite make out...

event.text: "Err... who are you to question our decisions? We spent eight years slogging it out against every godforsaken bug in this reality! You'd want out as well, I tell you.

choice.text: The battles were long ago. We won't hold you to it.

event.text: "They were indeed, captain. In fact, I've still got some of my old equipment in the stores back here, want to take a look?"

choice.text: The Federation has no use for cowardly deserters. Kill him.

event.text: You pull out your blaster, ending this traitor's life with one shot. You loot his stores.

event.name: GB_ASTEROID_AUTOCANNON_STORE
event.text: You expected to see a a large supply depot and patrols in this area but to your surprise you initially couldn't find anything worth of note at this beacon, you started to charge your FTL drive until you pick up a signal coming from a derelict vessel in a nearby asteroid field. Worth taking a look?

You are surprised to see a derelict outpost inside a crater of a dwarf planet inside the asteroid field. As you approach for a landing they hail you on Federation channels. "Wasn't expecting a Federation vessel coming this way into our area of operations for another couple of months. We're short on munitions, and we're struggling to provide for the strikes this far deep in enemy territory with how infrequent supply runs have been. Perhaps we can come to an arrangement?"

choice.text: Hand over some ammunition to access a store. [-5 }]

event.text: "These old things are running the foolproof classic load out of autocannons and bombs. Works perfectly fine up until you operate a bit further than a stone toss away from the supply lines. Hard getting supplies this far out without being overt in this enemy sector. You're more than free to take some off our hands in our inventory. No use keeping cannons that can't fire."

choice.text: If they're low on ammo they're an easy target, attack!

event.text: As you charge up your weapons, you detect a vessel coming in fast, must be one of the interdictors that was operating near by. You get ready for battle!
We don't have time for a wild goose chase.

choice.text: Do something on board the ship.

event.name: GB_STOREEVENT_ALIEN_AUTOCANNONS
event.text: You find yourself surrounded by a variety of vessels, each in colourful markings and symbols. Some are more familiar like some Federation ships, others are more exotic and unknown. It appears that you have stumbled across a fair, selling artefacts from the Mantis War, an age before alternate realities were even known of. There are a few merchants trying to attract your attention.
"These guns: vital in defence against the [Harmony]. The Harmony: Harms many. These [guns] also harm many. I have many guns. Purchase or I shall [harm]."
The Separatist directs you over to their many wares.

choice.text: Trade with the grizzled Federation veteran.

event.text: The highly decorated soldier grunts at you, and gestures vaguely towards some weapons they have on display. Not much of a talker it seems.
The soldier stands to attention as you move to inspect their stock.
The Free Mantis chatters excitedly at you. "Other traders, they don't like me. But you are Feddy man yes? You trade with me. Come see, I have thingies to sell!".
"I taking these weapons from Engi supplies in big war. You want see?"

event.name: GB_STOREEVENT_ENTHUSIAST_CANNONS
event.text: As soon as you jump in, you are immediatly hailed repeatedly by the Miltiiaman. "Guests!, come in and visit my brand new Ballistics Emporium! We sell Cannons! Missiles! And uh... other things, because no one buys the god damn Cannons and missiles! But please, buy my Cannons!"
"Oh good, oh good! Guests at last! Have you come to purchase an Autocannon? Perhaps a mint condition Leto? Oh please, my stock is expansive, endless even!"

You expect the Militiaman to get offended, but instead she gets even more excited. "I found this not too long ago but I have been reserving it for someone special. You're the first person to show any interest, so here you go!"
"I hope you enjoy it!" The Militiaman dances with joy. You take a browse of the market as well on your way out.
The Militiaman's voice suddenly turns cold. "Head right, you'll find the general marketplace..." She storms off, her thunderous tears soak you as she goes by.
Why are so many people adamant on selling these things still? They won't for much longer if you have a say in it!
The station continues to target you with a slue of enthusiastic advertisements, but you simply fly away.

event.name: GB_CARAVAN_ABANDONED
event.text: You arrive to find what was once a supply caravan in a debris field; most likely victims of Pirates. There is no response to your hails.

choice.text: Dock with one of the transports and investigate.
Dock with one of the escorts and investigate.
(Recon Drone) Use a Recon Drone to quickly investigate each ship.
(Lifeform Scanners) Run a scan on the caravan to detect if there are any survivors.

event.name: GB_CARAVAN_ABANDONED_TRANSPORTER_GOOD
event.text: It looks that the pirates or who ever attacked the caravan had already taken anything it was transporting or otherwise not bolted to the floor. You salvage what you can before leaving.

choice.text: Take time to investigate one of the Escorts.

event.text: Although it'll take more time, surely there is something left behind worth looking for.

choice.text: (Scrap Recovery Arm) Attempt to recover additional salvage.

event.text: Your scrap recovery arm slowly gathers up any usable debris from the caravan wrecks drifting nearby.

choice.text: (Magnetic Arm) Attempt to recover additional salvage.

event.text: Your Magnetic Arm makes quick work out of collecting the small space debris that floats around the wreckages.

event.name: GB_CARAVAN_ABANDONED_TRANSPORTER_BAD
event.text: It looks that the pirates or who ever attacked the caravan had already taken most of the goods carried by the Transport, however they were not the most thorough and find reasonable salvage.

choice.text: Take time to investigate one of the Escorts.

event.text: Although it'll take more time, surely there is something left behind worth looking for.

event.name: GB_CARAVAN_ABANDONED_TRANSPORTER_AUGMENT
event.text: Who ever attacked the caravan must've missed this Transporter or mysteriously wasn't interested in ransacking it for its contents. Regardless the crew is long dead and there is ample supplies to help you stock yourself for your mission.

choice.text: Take time to investigate one of the Escorts.

event.text: Although it'll take more time, surely there is something left behind worth looking for.

event.name: GB_CARAVAN_ABANDONED_ESCORT_GOOD
event.text: The cause of the outcome of the engagement have been made clear once you boarded the vessel. It seems the escorts were still operating a few quaint autocannons and had ran out of ammunition during the fight. Upon examining the weapon you discover it is still in functional order albeit dry on ammunition and is ready to be installed!

choice.text: Take time to investigate one of the Transports.
(Slug Crew) When docking with the escort your slug senses something.

event.text: You heed your slugs advice and follow their directions to where the lifesource is. Where you find a man hunched over a weapon console. Although not in as severe a condition as initially expected but any longer and they would've most likely not made it. They sincerely thank you for saving them when you did and offer to join your crew. "I was a gunnery officer aboard our ship, consider myself somewhat of a crack shot too 'till I we began running dry towards the end of our caravans journey. Now I wish to pick up where I left off and make the universe a safer place from these raiders".

event.name: GB_CARAVAN_ABANDONED_ESCORT_CREW
event.text: The cause of the outcome of the engagement have been made clear once you boarded the vessel. It seems the escorts were still operating a few quaint autocannons and had ran out of ammunition during the fight. Likely during the last leg of their journey. Before you are able to begin salvaging your crew spots a survivor in the weapons room hunched over a console. Although not in as severe a condition as initially expected but any longer and they would've most likely not made it. They sincerely thank you for saving them when you did and offer to join your crew. "I was a gunnery officer aboard our ship, consider myself somewhat of a crack shot too 'till I we began running dry towards the end of our caravans journey. Now I wish to pick up where I left off and make the universe a safer place from these raiders".
After the survivor stabilizes back on your ship he agrees to allow you to salvage his ship as long as you help him give his former crew a proper respects and a burial at space.

choice.text: Take time to investigate one of the Transports.

event.name: GB_CARAVAN_ABANDONED_ESCORT_BAD
event.text: It appears that this escort had suffered from a catastrophic ammunition detonation which put a swift yet brutal end to the crew of this ship. The ships internals are warped and twisted metal frame. There is not much inside the ship to salvage and even less so on the outside.

choice.text: Take time to investigate one of the Transports.
(Scrap Recovery Arm) Attempt to recover additional salvage.

event.text: Your scrap recovery arm slowly gathers up any usable debris from the caravan wrecks drifting nearby.

choice.text: (Magnetic Arm) Attempt to recover additional salvage.

event.text: Your Magnetic Arm makes quick work out of collecting the small space debris that floats around the wreckages.

event.name: GB_CARAVAN_ABANDONED_RECON
event.text: You repeatedly deploy your Recon Drone as it finishes investigating each ship. Moving through each ones swiftly and analysing the environment on a timely manner. The Transports have mostly been sacked during the attack however the Recon Drone's camera feed does show that the pirates have not been so thorough as initially thought, leaving behind some some useful salvage.

Just as you finish salvaging the the transport your Recon Drone on the last ship alerts you about a survivor on one of the escorts, however it would take time to finish salvaging the Transport and rescue them.

Thanks to your recon drone you were able to find them just in time and are able to stabilize their condition once aboard your ship. He states that he was a gunnery officer aboard their ship and that they were ambushed just before their final destination and were low on ammunition unable to defend themselves. They offer their sincerest gratitude for rescuing them and offer to join your crew.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Lock on to the survivors life signature and beam them onto your ship.

event.text: Thanks to your recon drone you were able to find them just in time and are able to stabilize their condition once aboard your ship. He states that he was a gunnery officer aboard their ship and that they were ambushed just before their final destination and were low on ammunition unable to defend themselves. They offer their sincerest gratitude for rescuing them and offer to join your crew.
You have an important mission, you have already spent salvaging the transporter. You prepare to move on.

event.name: GB_CARAVAN_ABANDONED_SCAN
event.text: Scans indicate that there is 1 lifeform onboard one of the better off escorts. The signal is faint but stable.

choice.text: Investigate the escort and rescue them.

event.text: You head directly towards where the lifeform was detected. Where you find a man hunched over a weapons console. Although not in as severe a condition as initially expected but any longer and they would've most likely not made it. They sincerely thank you for saving them when you did and offer to join your crew. Now I wish to pick up where I left off and make the universe a safer place from these raiders".

event.name: GB_MILITIA_ESCORT
event.text: The source of the distress beacon is emanating from a small Militia Escort. "Captain! We're very low on fuel and need some repairs desperately. Could you possibly take us to the nearest repair platform?"
"Thank you very much Captain. I'm sure we can arrange some remuneration at the shipyards.
"Ok, captain. We'll just, uhh, die here then."

choice.text: Do something on board the ship.

event.text: You've decided, instead of helping the Militiamen, to brutally attack them instead.

event.name: GB_QUEST_MILITIA_ESCORT
event.text: You've arrived at the shipyards, and receive a message from the Militiamen thanking you. They dispatch a shipwright to install a specialised piece of equipment on your ship.

event.name: GB_FED_BOMBER_DISTRESS
event.text: You arrive at the beacon, only to find a Federation Bomber with its hull in tatters. Upon hailing, they explain that they had a run-in with some Mantis and are desperately low on ammo.

choice.text: Give them a small amount of ammo. [-3}]

event.text: It isn't much, but it's all you can spare. Hopefully it'll be enough to keep them alive until a supply convoy finds its way here. The crew offer a few spare droneparts to recompense.

choice.text: Give them a medium amount of ammo. [-5}]

event.text: "Thank you, sir. This should be plenty to get us out of this hellhole." The crew dispense an augment to help you on your mission.

choice.text: Give them a large amount of ammo. [-10}]

event.text: You hand over a significant amount of ammunition to the stranded Federation soldiers. Their captain messages you: "We don't have much to give, but we could probably spare one of our weapons. The other 3 should be plenty."
"You can just... make ammo? Man, why haven't we ever got one of these? We'd be happy to buy it off you if you can spare it. We have scrap.
You decide you need the recycler more than these stranded soldiers and prepare to move on.

You hand over your ammo crate to the stranded Federation soldiers. Their captain messages you: "We don't have much to give, but we could probably spare one of our weapons. The other 3 should be plenty."

choice.text: If they're low on ammo they're an easy target, attack!

event.text: You power up your weapons and prepare to obliterate your allies.
